E-Levy implementation: Salaries paid from companies to individual bank account no e-levy applies.  Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints
E-Levy implementation: ATM withdrawals do not attract e-levy so we are safe. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints
E-Levy implementation: If you use checks no e-levy will apply. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: If you're doing payment online from your debit card may be through Amazon (it is not registered with the GRA) so you will pay e-levy. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: You will always see a prompt when transacting. Once there is a figure you will know that the person is not on the GRA platform hence, you will be charged. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints
E-Levy implementation: The coverage is five and the exemptions are seven under the e-levy. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: When the person/meechant is registered on the GRA platform. Then you can use the payment option on the Momo platform for you to be exempted. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: When the person is transferring hundred cedis every day he is not poor and he is exempted from the e-levy. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints

E-Levy implementation: On the Momo platform there is a distinction between a transfer and payment. Don't use transfers to make payment to be on a safer side. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints
E-Levy implementation: If you transfer from your bank account to Momo you won't be charged. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints
E-Levy implementation: If your transfer exceeds Ghc100 from one account to the other person that is where the e-levy applies. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints
E-Levy implementation: We are using the identities behind the name and that's where the Ghana card comes in. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints
E-Levy: If you're making a transfer on the same network that comes under the purview of the e-levy act. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints
E-Levy: The first hundred cedis is tax-free in a day. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints
E-Levy: There won't be any drastic change but extra information will appear on your phone to see the charges. Member of the E-Levy Technical Committee, GRA Isaac Amoako TheKeyPoints

E-Levy passed: We wanted to stop the e-levy by any means necessary. Fmr. Deputy Finance Minister, Kweku Ricketts Hagan TheKeyPoints

E-Levy passed: We wanted to see this through in terms of voting. It became a tactical game in the sense that we were looking at numbers by monitoring each other. Fmr. Deputy Finance Minister, Kweku Ricketts Hagan TheKeyPoints

E-Levy passed: The average Ghanaians didn't want the E-Levy. The people outside basically influenced us in parliament because we represent them. Fmr. Deputy Finance Minister, Kweku Ricketts Hagan TheKeyPoints

E-Levy passed: The responsibility of  parliament is to shape government’s proposals to the will of the people. Parliamentarians represent the people. Fmr. MP for Suhum, Hon. Frederick Opare Ansah TheKeyPoints
E-Levy passed: It looks like it's a rubber stamp for the opposition. Fmr. MP for Suhum, Hon. Frederick Opare Ansah TheKeyPoints

E-Levy stalemate: Ghana was ripe for Arab spring because of joblessness says President Nana Addo. MP for Tamale Central, Murtala Mohammed TheKeyPoints

E-Levy stalemate: When you're in difficult challenges you need to cut your cost. You have a president who travels in a luxurious private jet. You owe us a responsibility to tell us how much you spent. MP for Tamale Central, Murtala Mohammed TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: The ordinary man is interested in how much he is paying for transportation and his livelihood and not big economic jargon.MP for Tamale Central, Murtala Mohammed TheKeyPoints

E-Levy stalemate: What you want to do as a country is that you need to educate and take the people along with you. That is what a caring government should do if it wants to introduce any tax. Senior Advisor - APNAC, Prof. David Abdulai TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: If there is a coup, all of us will suffer. Don't even dream of it. MP for Nhyiaeso, Stephen Amoah TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: Things started getting bad when COVID19 came in. MP for Nhyiaeso, Stephen Amoah TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: We live in a country that because of politics people veer into areas they do not know of. MP for Nhyiaeso, Stephen Amoah TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: We don't normally engage people before we introduce a tax.MP for Nhyiaeso, Stephen Amoah TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: People are not against taxes, this tax regime exerts more pressure on the poor than the rich. MP for Tamale Central, Murtala Mohammed TheKeyPoints

E-Levy stalemate: It's not true that Ghanaians are against taxes, they are against regressive taxes. They refuse to be taxed when because you (NPP) cannot account for the taxes you have taken already. MP for Tamale Central, Murtala Mohammed TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: When we went on recess in December, the NPP never engaged us on the e-levy. MP for Tamale Central, Murtala Mohammed TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: You should leave a legacy when you're in power because you will not reign forever. Senior Advisor - APNAC, Prof. David Abdulai TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: There is a need for consensus-building in this hung parliament because both parties have lost some members in parliament. Senior Advisor - APNAC, Prof. David Abdulai TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: There should be a consensus as to how much they (NPP) want to charge with the threshold for the e-levy.Senior Advisor - APNAC, Prof. David Abdulai TheKeyPoints

E-Levy stalemate: No Ghanaian is against taxes, the strategy that the finance minister is using is not the best. There should be an earlier engagement with stakeholders before taxes are introduced. Senior Advisor - APNAC, Prof. David Abdulai TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: We need to generate taxes and develop the country. It will be in the interest of Ghanaians to support us to pass the e-levy. MP for Nhyiaeso, Stephen Amoah TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: If we pass the e-levy we will generate taxes and it will help Ghanaians. If we don't pass it, we will all suffer. MP for Nhyiaeso, Stephen Amoah TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: Our fiscal space is messed up and you can't blame the government. MP for Nhyiaeso, Stephen Amoah TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: Why don't they want us to pass the e-levy? MP for Nhyiaeso, Stephen Amoah TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: In Ghana here nobody wants to pay tax, it's a fact. MP for Nhyiaeso, Stephen Amoah TheKeyPoints
E-Levy stalemate: When have we introduced new taxes for Ghanaians to be happy about it? MP for Nhyiaeso, Stephen Amoah TheKeyPoints
